meanings.def: a pattern of straight lines, usually crossing each other to form squares
examples: The artist drew a set of grid lines over the area to be painted.
We superimposed a grid over the image.

meanings.def: a frame of metal or wooden bars that are parallel or cross each other
a pattern of squares on a map that are marked with letters or numbers to help you find the exact position of a place
examples: An Ordnance Survey grid reference gives the position of a place to within 100 metres.
Each of the grid squares on the map is equal to one square kilometre.
The grid lines on the map run north-south.

meanings.def: a system of electric wires or pipes carrying gas, for sending power over a large area
examples: the national grid (= the electricity supply in a country)
the development of the country’s electricity grid
Power can be fed from wind generators into the electricity grid system.

meanings.def: a pattern of lines marking the starting positions for the racing cars
examples: The 20-year-old didn't get the best of starts off the grid.

meanings.def: a number of computers that are linked together using the internet so that they can share power, data, etc. in order to work on difficult problems
not using the public supplies of electricity, gas, water, etc.
examples: The mountain cabin is entirely off the grid.
You can produce your own power and live off the grid.

idioms.def: not using the public supplies of electricity, gas, water, etc.
examples: The mountain cabin is entirely off the grid.
You can produce your own power and live off the grid.
